metadata.Description: Storage systems that store electrical energy in batteries for later use.

subelement_relations.Description: Lithium-ion batteries are a type of rechargeable battery commonly used in battery storage systems. They have a high energy density, long cycle life, and low self-discharge rate, making them suitable for storing and releasing energy in sustainable energy applications.

Lead-acid batteries are a type of rechargeable battery commonly used in battery storage systems. They are known for their low cost, high surge current capability, and ability to withstand high discharge rates. However, they have a lower energy density and shorter cycle life compared to lithium-ion batteries.

Flow batteries are a type of rechargeable battery commonly used in large-scale energy storage systems. They store energy in liquid electrolytes contained in external tanks, allowing for flexible capacity and longer duration storage. Flow batteries are suitable for applications requiring long-duration energy storage and frequent cycling.

Sodium-sulfur batteries are a type of rechargeable battery commonly used in grid-scale energy storage systems. They operate at high temperatures and use molten sulfur and sodium as the active materials. Sodium-sulfur batteries have a high energy density and long cycle life, making them suitable for large-scale energy storage.

Nickel-cadmium batteries are a type of rechargeable battery commonly used in portable and backup power applications. They have a long cycle life, high discharge rate, and wide operating temperature range. However, they have a lower energy density compared to lithium-ion batteries and are being phased out due to environmental concerns.

relations.Description: Battery storage implements the Energy Storage Policy to promote the use of energy storage technologies for grid stability and renewable energy integration.
Battery storage funds research and development activities to improve battery technologies and enhance energy storage capabilities.
Battery storage focuses on grid integration to enable the seamless integration of renewable energy sources and enhance grid stability.
Battery storage is used in renewable energy projects to store excess energy generated from renewable sources for later use.
Battery storage partners with electric vehicle manufacturers to develop advanced battery technologies for electric vehicles.
Battery storage contributes to the energy transition by enabling the integration of renewable energy sources and reducing reliance on fossil fuels.
Battery storage monitors battery performance to ensure optimal operation and identify any issues or degradation in performance.
Battery storage targets the increase of energy storage capacity to support the growth of renewable energy and enhance grid flexibility.
